model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant, enabling the Speaker B to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

The output format should be as follows:

Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: The portrait you ordered is coming along swimmingly! How are the little furries doing?
Speaker B: They are doing well. I think I am going to paint a portrait of my great dane standing next to my pet rat lol. Do you know where you want to get your new cat from?
Speaker A: Someone I work with at the dog daycare works at a shelter.  I think I will go there.
Speaker B: That's great. I have gotten my pets from the shelter and they seem happy I brought them home. I have a hard time saying no to them which is why I have so many pets. Cats are easier to take care of than dogs. Do you have a name in mind for your cat? 
Speaker A: I've thought of a lot of  names, but in the end it will probably depend on the breed and the sex.  
Speaker B: That's true. Is pilates hard? I've always wanted to try it but I don't know if it will be too difficult.
Speaker A: No, I don't think it's hard.  I actually enjoy it.  It's more fun than work, at least to me. You should give it a try! 

MEMORY 1:
Speaker B's prices for a portrait start at $5000 to pay for college tuition. Speaker B prefers painting regular people over professionals, discovered love for portraits through a self-portrait with pets. Speaker B thinks pit bulls are lovely and has one that is kind and sweet. Speaker B likes Persian cats and imagines their pets having interesting interactions. 
Both speakers enjoy walking in the city and staying busy with their respective activities. Speaker B has five dogs and enjoys taking them to the park. Both Speaker A and Speaker B enjoy the company of their pets and think they are smart and playful. 
Speaker A has a brother and might commission a family portrait from Speaker B. Speaker B prefers painting regular people over professionals, discovered love for portraits through a self-portrait with pets. Speaker B thinks pit bulls are lovely and has one that is kind and sweet. Speaker A prefers adopting pets from shelters rather than from breeders.

MEMORY 2:
User Description:
Speaker A is an individual who finished a novel and reads about one novel a week, lives in the city, walks a lot, especially to work, has a pilates class as their favorite activity, and has an only brother. They might have $5000 in the petty cash drawer.

Relationship Description:
Speaker A is excited about a portrait being painted by Speaker B and hopes the interest in painting keeps up. Speaker B is looking forward to painting for Speaker A and has more professionals asking to paint for them. Speaker A congratulates Speaker B on painting for Elton John.

Event Description:
Speaker A is frustrated when animals are sick and hopes the vet helped the sick dog. Speaker B's rats look worried for the sick dog, and Speaker B believes the sick dog will be fine. Speaker A is getting kittens from a shelter and thinks it's important to rescue pets. Speaker B is taking care of a sick dog and would get a Persian cat if possible. Speaker A is also getting more than one kitten to play with each other. Speaker B thinks Speaker A will love the cute fur balls and believes getting a cat would be like a Tom and Jerry scene in the house.

YOUR OUTPUT:
prediction:
Explanation: In the dialogue context, Speaker B has shifted the conversation from discussing pets and potential pet names to a new topic about pilates and whether it is difficult or not. Relevant information would be about Speaker A's experience or opinion on pilates or any related activities. However, only MEMORY 2 mentions pilates as Speaker A's favorite activity, making it directly relevant and useful for responding appropriately to the inquiry about pilates.
